content:
Repeat Options in the FlexCard Designer

By default, a FlexCard loops through records returned from its data source. The FlexCard displays the list of records in containers called cards.

Improve the performance on rerendered elements when a FlexCard with repeating records updates. Only rerender the affected card record in the FlexCard component by entering a unique Render Key that identifies it.

To display data that doesn't need repeating, disable the Repeat Records feature. For example, disable the feature to display a Chart element that displays data from multiple Accounts or a Datatable element that lists Account Cases.

Repeatable Modes

This table displays how the Repeat Records feature works for an Active State and a Blank Card State when records are available and not available:

ENABLED? RECORDS AVAILABLE? ACTIVE STATE BLANK CARD STATE
Yes Yes Show a card for each available record. Hidden
Yes No Hidden Show one card, such as to show an action link to create a record.
No Yes Show one card with all available records inside it. When a condition results in no records to show, this state is hidden.
No No Hidden Show one card, such as to show an action link to create a record.

Disable Record Looping on a FlexCard
To display data that doesn't need repeating in a Chart or Datatable, disable the Repeat Records feature.

Improve Performance of Repeated Records on a FlexCard
Improve the performance on rerendered elements when a FlexCard with repeating records updates.
title: Repeat Options in FlexCard Designer
